net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.composite

Class DateFormatLabel

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.ComponentImpl
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.Label
        • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.composite.DateFormatLabel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyChangeListener, Iterable<Component>, EventListener, net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocaleContextSource, Component, ListCellRenderer, TableCellRenderer, TreeCellRenderer

    public class DateFormatLabel
extends Label
implements PropertyChangeListener

    Displays a date as static text. This class is useful as a table/tree cell renderer when the cell value is a java.util.Date object. The DateFormat may be specified to control the format.

    This component supports a "friendly" date, i.e. one that selects a different format depending on what the current time is. This may allow shortening the string. The actual implementation for this format is FriendlyDateFormat.

    This class uses the time zone set in the session.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

           throws CannotCloseMIWTException
        Description copied from interface: Component
        Close the component. Component cleanup should be done here. This method detaches the component from the window manager and clears all event and property listeners. This method should only be called if Component.init() has been called.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

      • createFriendlyInstance

        @Nonnull
public static DateFormatLabel createFriendlyInstance(@Nullable
                                             Date value)
        Create a "friendly" instance meaning that the date text will be set depending on the current date. If you'd like to use a "friendly" date format outside of MIWT you'll want to look at FriendlyDateFormat.
        Parameters:
        value - The date value, may be null in which case the current date is used.
        Returns:
        DateFormatLabel.

                                      boolean isSelected,
                                      boolean hasFocus,
                                      int row,
                                      int column)
        Description copied from class: Label
        If the text value is null, take on the String representation of the value, otherwise keep the set value. Returns a Component to use for renderering a cell in a table.
        Specified by:
        getTableCellRendererComponent in interface TableCellRenderer
        Overrides:
        getTableCellRendererComponent in class Label
        Parameters:
        table - The Table that has the data being rendered.
        value - The value of the cell being rendered.
        isSelected - Indicates whether the cell is in a selected state.
        hasFocus - Indicates if the cell has focus, implementations may want to indicate this in the UI.
        row - The row for the cell.
        column - The column model index (NOT the model index!).
        Returns:
        An object that is a Component which can be used to display the value stored in the specified table cell.

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: Component

        Called when a Component is first attached to a WindowManager. This means the Component should have valid return values from getApplication(), getLocaleContext(), getParent(). It is preferable to have all construction of the Component go here since a valid LocaleContext, Application object, etc., are available.

        When overriding this method, be sure to call the super class init(). init() is called only once for each Component. The parent component will have been init()ed before init() is called.

        NOTE: Do not call this method from application code. It is meant to be called by the WindowManager only.

        Specified by:
        init in interface Component
        Overrides:
        init in class Label

      • setDate

        public void setDate(@Nullable
           Date date)
        Set the date value for this component. If date is null nothing is displayed for the component.
        Parameters:

        IllegalArgumentException - if format is null.

      • setRendererValue

        protected void setRendererValue(Object value)
        Set the text for this component from a cell renderer value. If the value is null, the displayed text is the empty string. If the value is a java.util.Date or java.lang.Long object the value is the formatted date. Other objects using the string value of the object for the displayed text.
        Parameters:
        value - The value.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Description copied from class: Label
        Returns a string indicating the text value, which may be truncated for length. This method cannot be used to display the text, use getText().
        Overrides:
        toString in class Label

      • validate

        public void validate()
        Description copied from interface: Component

        Normally called by the medium to make sure the component is in a valid state before updating the medium. Other classes may safely call as needed. Note however that validating may take a substantial amount of work depending on the subclass implementation!.

        NOTE: When overriding this method, be sure to call the super class validate() as the last statement in the overridden method.

        Specified by:
        validate in interface Component
        Overrides:
        validate in class Label
